stem: A 36-year-old patient presents after a fall with an abducted, externally rotated shoulder. After reduction, which finding would signal injury to the axillary nerve?

choices.B: Loss of sensation over the lateral shoulder
choices.C: Absent radial pulse with elbow flexed
choices.E: Loss of finger flexion in digits 2 and 3

rationale_correct: The axillary nerve innervates the deltoid and provides sensation over the regimental badge area; numbness there indicates axillary nerve injury from anterior dislocation.

rationale_distractors.A: Wrist extension is radial nerve dependent and reflects spiral groove or posterior interosseous lesions.
rationale_distractors.C: Radial pulse changes suggest vascular compromise rather than axillary nerve damage.
rationale_distractors.D: Pronation relies on median nerve innervation of pronator teres/quadratus.
rationale_distractors.E: Loss of finger flexion in digits 2 and 3 suggests median nerve compromise.
